Add/Replace/Delete.Description: The ADD/Delete/Replace modifiers are used in a definition to Add/Delete/Replace an attribute to the Definition.
Add/Replace/Delete.Name: Add/Replace/Delete

Advanced.Description: This attribute allows hiding certain objects in a collection. The objects meeting this condition are hidden and are displayed when user types in the string for searching.
Advanced.Name: Advanced

Aggr By Track.Description: Attribute to track the object id's
Aggr By Track.Name: Aggr By Track

Aggr Compute.Description: This attribute is used for aggregation purpose based on the criteria(s) specified with attribute By.

Parameters.Keywords: Add, High, Last, Low, Max, Min, Sum

Aggr Compute.Name: Aggr Compute

Aggr Compute Track.Description: Attribute help to keep track of objects contributed to the aggr method

Meta.Aliases: Aggr Compute Track, Aggr Method Track

Aggr Compute Track.Name: Aggr Compute Track

Alias.Description: The attribute will display the aliases of the groups in the specified table.

Meta.Aliases: Alias, Aliases, With Alias, With Aliases

Alias.Name: Alias

Align.Description: This attribute aligns the collection by the field to the position assigned (Top/Left/Right/Centre)  when the collection is used as a Table in the field definition.

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Align.Name: Align

Allow Noise Chars.Description: This attribute allows the exclusion of noise characters while populating objects in a table.

Meta.Aliases: Allow Noise Chars, Table Has Path

Allow Noise Chars.Name: Allow Noise Chars

AlternateURL.Description: It is used to specify the alternate URL (for Remote Url) of the HTTP server delivering the XML data.
AlternateURL.Name: AlternateURL

API.Description: It is used to specify the URL of the HTTP server delivering the XML data.
API.Name: API

Belongs To.Description: This attribute can be used only with child of attribute.By default this attribute value is “no”, If It is specified as “No” then all object having parent as a object name specified in child of attribute (i.e. Direct Childs) will be gathered. If it is specified as a “Yes” the all direct indirect Childs of object name specified in child of attribute will be gathered.
Belongs To.Name: Belongs To

Break On.Description: It used to validate the XML data received from DLL function. Usually we specify error code as parameter for this if any of these string passed is available in received data then the collection will not be gathered.
Break On.Name: Break On

By.Description: It allows to specify the criteria based on which the aggregation is done.
By.Name: By

Child Of.Description: If the main object of collection in attribute Type specified is transaction type and sub object as well, then Child of attribute accepts the name of sub object.It gives all transaction having occurrence of sub object. If the main object of collection is master type then child of attribute accepts name of parent. Then the collection will be gathered for all masters  belonging to parent specified.
Child Of.Name: Child Of

Cleared.Description: This attribute will include only cleared bills/voucher depending upon it's value Yes or No.
Cleared.Name: Cleared

Client Only.Description: This attribute is used to collect data from the collection locally, and not to send request to the server for collection data.
Client Only.Name: Client Only

Collection.Description: This attribute is used to represent the resultant collection and it will be union of  all objects  of  the collections specified  in the list.
Collection.Name: Collection

Color.Description: This attribute allows changing the font colour/foreground colour of column values in a Table.
Color.Name: Color

Column Align.Description: This attribute allows providing comma-separated alignment values for the columns (Left/Right/Centre/Prompt).

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Column Align.Name: Column Align

Column Var.Description: It is used for repeating the variables in for columnar report.
Column Var.Name: Column Var

Compute.Description: This attributes is used to fetch the required methods from the source collection and allows to assign an alias to the methods.
Compute.Name: Compute

Compute Var.Description: It evaluates the value based on the current objects.
Compute Var.Name: Compute Var

Data Source.Description: To populate a collection using a variety of sources. Valid data source types are JSON, HTTP JSON, XML, HTTP XML, ODBC, Rule Set, and so on.

Parameters.Keywords: Antivirus Details, Application Excel Maps, Application Report Views, Associated Tnet Lic List, Autobackups on Disk, Autobackup Status, Autobackup Versions, AxPlugIn XML, Backup EmailIds List, Bank Statement, Capsule Xml, Cmp Scheduled Task List, Company Excel Maps, Company Report Views, Company Restore List, Company Selection List, Computer Details, Customer Profile, Directory, Directory Selection List, Event Log List, Excel Column Names, Excel Header Names, Excel Sheet Names, Exchange, Exchange Activity Objects, Exchange Cache, Exchange Contributors, Exchange Objects, Extensions List, File JSON, File JSONZip, File Selection List, File XML, Firewall Details, Flag Set, Hard Disk Details, HTTP JSON, HTTP XML, Imf Statement, JSON Files, JSON String, LoggedIn Session List, Name Set, Net Adapter Details, Notification, Num Set, Online Backup List, Online Backup Version List, Parent Report, PlugIn XML, Recon, Report, Report Stack, Rule Set, Scheduled Task List, Secure Capsule Xml, System Installed Instances, TDL Statistics, TGS Computer Details, USB Sign Certificates, Variable, XML String

Data Source.Name: Data Source

Excel Sheet Info.Description: This attribute is used to specify the sheet name of the Excel, as well as the starting and ending cell/column names.
Excel Sheet Info.Name: Excel Sheet Info

Exclude.Description: This attribute is used to exclude the group specified from the collection.
Exclude.Name: Exclude

Explode.Description: This attribute allows exploding to another collection in a Table. By default, the exploded collection will be displayed in the table. Based on the second parameter, the collection would be exploded. If the third parameter is specified as FALSE/ NO, then the collection will be gathered during the collection construct; however; would not be displayed. By default, the third parameter is TRUE/YES.
Explode.Name: Explode

Export Header.Description: To specify the HTTP request headers for a GET or POST request.
Export Header.Name: Export Header

Fetch.Description: This attributes is used to fetch the required methods from the source collection.
Fetch.Name: Fetch

Filter.Description: It specifies in which the record to be included based on the condition.
Filter.Name: Filter

Filter Var.Description: It evaluates the value based on the objects available in collection after the evaluation of attributes Fetch and Compute.
Filter Var.Name: Filter Var

Format.Description: Adds a column to the table to show specific values from the object.
Format.Name: Format

Full Height.Description: It is used to check whether the table display of the collection will have full height or not.
Full Height.Name: Full Height

Include.Description: Lists the object(group, ledger etc) names to be included in the collection.
Include.Name: Include

Include Deleted.Description: This attribute is used to determine whether the deleted transactions are to be included as part of a collection or not. This is applicable only for the voucher of the company.
Include Deleted.Name: Include Deleted

Indent.Description: This attribute aids to move the characters to the left in the column. However, it is highly used within Exploded Tables.
Indent.Name: Indent

Input Parameter.Description: The attribute Input Parameter is used to pass single string value to the DLL function.
Input Parameter.Name: Input Parameter

Input XML.Description: The attribute Input XML is used to pass XML format data to an external DLL.
Input XML.Name: Input XML

Is ODBC Table.Description: This attribute is used to check whether this collection is exposed to ODBC or Not.
Is ODBC Table.Name: Is ODBC Table

JSON Object.Description: To specify the object (user-defined or schema object) to which the data in the JSON/XML file has to be mapped.
JSON Object.Name: JSON Object

JSON Object Path.Description: To specify the path to the data fragment that is to be extracted from the given JSON/XML file and converted to a TDL object in the collection. By default, the data fragment starts from the root node.

Meta.Aliases: JSON Object Path, SQLObject, XML Object Path

JSON Object Path.Name: JSON Object Path

KBLanguage.Description: This is used to gather master created in particular language id.If we require all masters irrespective of language in which it is created,provide parameter as zero else provide the language id of the masters as required.
KBLanguage.Name: KBLanguage

Keep Contributors.Description: Used to specify if the contributors are to be maintained as a sub collection. This can later be used to identify which objects participated in the aggregation
Keep Contributors.Name: Keep Contributors

Keep Source.Description: Keep Source is used to retain the source data in main memory.
Keep Source.Name: Keep Source

List.Description: This attribute is used to list the strings to be included as the content of the collection.
List.Name: List

Local Formula.Description: This is used to specify a local formula within the Import Object Definition .
Local Formula.Name: Local Formula

Max.Description: This is the maximum number of records to be gathered from database.
Max.Name: Max

New Object.Description: Depending upon the condition, the type of the object will be added at the collection level
New Object.Name: New Object

Object.Description: This attribute specifies the user defined objects that needs to be part of the collection.
Object.Name: Object

ODBC.Description: This attribute is used to specify the FileDSN.  The data from ODBC tables can be pulled in Tally and can be saved and displayed as a report. To achieve the connectivity DSN has to be created.
ODBC.Name: ODBC

Option.Description: Option is an attribute which can be used by various definitions, to provide a conditional result in a program.
Option.Name: Option

Parm Var.Description: The attribute Param Var is a context free structure available within the collection which evaluates the expression in context of the caller/Request or Object.
Parm Var.Name: Parm Var

Prefetch.Description: This attributes is used to prefetch the required methods into the source object.
Prefetch.Name: Prefetch

Primary Status.Description: This attribute will be used to select link masters which has a specific primary status
Primary Status.Name: Primary Status

ReCompute.Description: This attributes is used to fetch the required methods from the source collection and allows to assign an alias to the methods. Executed only in Re-walk mode
ReCompute.Name: ReCompute

Recon Status.Description: This attribute will be used to select external data which has a specific recon status
Recon Status.Name: Recon Status

RemoteRequest.Description: It is used to specify the Report name which is to be sent to the HTTP server as an XML Request and the XML response is obtained in the collection.
RemoteRequest.Name: RemoteRequest

Repeat.Description: This attribute is used to specify the periodicity between two dates Like week, month etc. Whenever we need to repeat the collection based on the periodicity,this attribute is used
Repeat.Name: Repeat

Report.Description: It displays a new report specified in this attribute, based on the object selected from the collection in the trigger report.
Report.Name: Report

Report List.Description: Lists the Report names whose names are  to be displayed in the content of the collection.
Report List.Name: Report List

ReWalk.Description: This is used in line with Walk attribute. To allow a re-walk of the collection specified during walk and execute Re-compute statements
ReWalk.Name: ReWalk

Search Key.Description: It is used to create index dynamically where the key is defined and the Collection is indexed in the memory using the Key. Any object can be searched instantly using the index.
Search Key.Name: Search Key

Secondary Status.Description: This attribute will be used to select link masters which has a specific secondary status
Secondary Status.Name: Secondary Status

Set.Description: This attribute is used to set the default value to the field of a table.
Set.Name: Set

Sort.Description: Specifies the sorting method on the specified method/ function/ formula.
Sort.Name: Sort

Source Collection.Description: In summary collection, it specifies the collections to be used for source data.
Source Collection.Name: Source Collection

Source Fetch.Description: This attribute is used to fetch the required methods from an object of the source collection.
Source Fetch.Name: Source Fetch

Source PreFetch.Description: This attribute is used to prefetch the required methods into an object of the source collection.

Meta.Aliases: Source PreFetch, Source Pre Native Method

Source PreFetch.Name: Source PreFetch

Source Var.Description: It evaluates the value based on the source object.
Source Var.Name: Source Var

SQL.Description: It is used to access the data from external text file/ODBC table.
SQL.Name: SQL

SQL Parms.Description: If any parameters to be passed on to Tally with the procedure by SQL Query should be declared by the attribute SQLParms. The parameters names within TDL should be declared as System Variables with specific Data Types.
SQL Parms.Name: SQL Parms

SQLValues.Description: This attribute is used to declare the matrix of values that will get retuned from the an SQL Procedure.
SQLValues.Name: SQLValues

Style.Description: This attribute allows changing the font style of column values in a Table.
Style.Name: Style

Sub Title.Description: It  gives title for each columns in the table.
Sub Title.Name: Sub Title

Switch.Description: 'Switch' attribute is similar to the Option attribute but reduces code complexity and improves the performance. The Switch are grouped using a label Once a condition is satisfied from one group, switch won't  check further conditions from the same group.  It will evaluate the conditions from the other groups specified, if any.
Switch.Name: Switch

Table Sort.Description: This attribute enables the sorting of the table columns based on their data types. You can specify a method, function, or formula for sorting.
Table Sort.Name: Table Sort

Table Text Compare.Description: This attribute is used to specify the comparison function during the sorting of columns.
Table Text Compare.Name: Table Text Compare

Title.Description: Specifies the Title for the Collection.
Title.Name: Title

Transaction Type.Description: This attribute will be used to select link masters which has a specific transaction type
Transaction Type.Name: Transaction Type

Trigger.Description: Triggers a report from collection and triggered report will work on selected object by user  in collection.
Trigger.Name: Trigger

Type.Description: It is used to specify the type of objects the collection  Holds.
Type.Name: Type

Unique.Description: It is used to control the display of unique values in the table for a specified method based on the values selected from the table previously in a field. The display of values is changed dynamically based on the field value.
Unique.Name: Unique

Use.Description: The USE keyword is used in a definition to reuse an existing definition.
Use.Name: Use

Variable.Description: Specifies the Variable name that holds the object selected by user to supply triggered report.
Variable.Name: Variable

Walk.Description: Walk allows specifying further elements to walk on the source and can be specified to any depth for within the source object.
Walk.Name: Walk

WalkEx.Description: WalkEx allows the specification of multiple walks on the same source object.
WalkEx.Name: WalkEx

XSLT.Description: The attribute XSLT is used to transforming XML document received from an external source to another XML document.
XSLT.Name: XSLT
